title: How large is black hole Ton 618 expected to be today 10.3 billion years after we first witnessed it? Is it expected to be stupendously large by now? How big is the upper limit of size for a black hole? - Enlightened 11:11 - Quora

response.answer_text: Black holes grow by accumulating material. There is no upper size but there is only a certain amount of nearby material for them to consume. In general objects won’t just fall into black holes - like water going down a drain or something - they orbit them. Gravitational interactions between orbiting bodies will send some towards the black hole but they equally flick stuff away from the black hole so over time the supply of nearby material dwindles. This places a limit on their growth.
